name: carddom
params: class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3
body: |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wb(wss(cfv(ccrd, c0), cfv(ccrd, c2)), wbr(c0, cdom, c2)))

stmt.origin: syl2an(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3), wb(wss(cfv(ccrd, c0), cfv(ccrd, c2)), wbr(c0, cdom, c2)), wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)), wcel(c2, cdm(ccrd)))
stmt.pretty: syl2an(c0 ∈ c1, c2 ∈ c3, ((card ` c0)⊆(card ` c2)↔ c0[≼]c2), c0 ∈ dom(card), c2 ∈ dom(card))

body.origin:
|- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wb(wss(cfv(ccrd, c0), cfv(ccrd, c2)), wbr(c0, cdom, c2)))
-| wi(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)))
-| wi(wcel(c2, c3), wcel(c2, cdm(ccrd)))
-| wi(wa(wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)), wcel(c2, cdm(ccrd))), wb(wss(cfv(ccrd, c0), cfv(ccrd, c2)), wbr(c0, cdom, c2)))
body.pretty:
⊢ ((c0 ∈ c1 ∧ c2 ∈ c3)→((card ` c0)⊆(card ` c2)↔ c0[≼]c2))
⊣ (c0 ∈ c1 → c0 ∈ dom(card))
⊣ (c2 ∈ c3 → c2 ∈ dom(card))
⊣ ((c0 ∈ dom(card)∧ c2 ∈ dom(card))→((card ` c0)⊆(card ` c2)↔ c0[≼]c2))

comment: Two sets have the dominance relationship iff their cardinalities have the subset relationship. Equation i of [Quine] p. 232. (Contributed by NM, 22-Oct-2003.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 30-Apr-2015.)
